posts.post_content:
Mediocre?
  
Turn 1 - [Death Cultist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Death Cultist)/[Viscera Seer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Viscera Seer)/[Plagued Rusalka](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Plagued Rusalka), or any other 1-drop that can sacrifice for free.
  
Turn 2 - 2 Cries of Contrition haunting you 1-drop, sacrifice it.
  
   
Suddenly, opponent's discarded 4 cards on turn 2, plus whatever other effect you got from sacrificing your creeature. And it wasn't even such an unlikely draw if you've built your deck well.
posts.html:
Mediocre?

Turn 2 - 2 Cries of Contrition haunting you 1-drop, sacrifice it.

Suddenly, opponent's discarded 4 cards on turn 2, plus whatever other effect you got from sacrificing your creeature. And it wasn't even such an unlikely draw if you've built your deck well.

posts.post_content: This card is funny to play after casting ravenous rats, then haunting the rats. If you keep making them discard stuff, it'll keep them from attacking long enough to ramp up to better creatures.

posts.post_content: I'm making a deck that's heavy on sacrificing right now. This will be fantastic for it. Largely for [Kalastria Highborn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kalastria Highborn)'s deal damage, gain life effect. Play this, have it haunt a creature I'm gonna sac next turn (or later in that turn) and it becomes deal 2 damage, gain 2 life, make opponent discard 2 cards. With the [Megrim](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Megrim) I'm throwing in....ouch.
